channel.title: So i wana make a 3d game
channel.description:
well, i know C, and i know how to 3d model (Autodesk Maya), and i want to creat a game, a simple one (but really want to make a RPG, baby steps), so i wana know the best and well the easiest 3d game engine, that has well alot of tutorials, and user-friendly.
anyone know?, if please do tell. thanks in advance.
i would love to make a game :p, it would mostly be when i am going to uni, about 1.5 hours train ride, if lucky or 2 hours.

item.title: So i wana make a 3d game
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Frell:

no payment until you gain at least $5000 worth of revenue

actually you have to pay $99 upfront as soon as you start using it for commercial purposes, before youve earned a dime (which is still pretty cheap)

however, over 5k you then pay a whopping 25% on all money you earn.

Read full topic
item.source: So i wana make a 3d game

item.title: So i wana make a 3d game
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

unreal engine has now gone free (no payment until you gain at least $5000 worth of revenue) and the Unity 3d engine has also gone free.

Unreal is used for games like gears of war(which it was made with) and there are tutorials everywhere.

Unity is for wii games sorta quality.

Both use a scripting system that you could use maybe.

You’re going to get kicked in the ass when you get to animation.

Read full topic
item.source: So i wana make a 3d game

item.title: So i wana make a 3d game
item.dc:creator: @twins twins
item.description:
@twins wrote:

Learn C# get 3d engine get a designer and a client operator start working

Read full topic

item.title: So i wana make a 3d game
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

If you want to use .NET and OGRE for development check out Axiom Engine. I use it for my 3d game and editor app, great project.

Read full topic
item.source: So i wana make a 3d game

item.title: So i wana make a 3d game
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

forgot to mention, ogre also has bindings to other languages, so if C++ isnt really your thing but you know, say, python or a .net language, you can use that.

its also the rendering engine behind the commercial game “torchlight”, as well as probably other stuff.

Read full topic
item.source: So i wana make a 3d game

item.title: So i wana make a 3d game
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

ogre is the way to go.

Read full topic
item.source: So i wana make a 3d game

item.title: So i wana make a 3d game
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

if you also know C++, irrlicht and ogre both have awesome communities and wikis and suchlike. they are both rendering engines, not full game engines, however, ogre especially is very nice to use.

Read full topic
